National Sentence Text:
A soil-or-waste pipe shall be of a size not less than the size of
a) a vent pipe that is connected to it, or
b) the largest soil-or-waste pipe that drains into it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), no drainage pipe that is of minimum size required by this Part for the purpose for which it is installed shall be so connected as to drain to other drainage pipe of lesser size.
Where a building drain connects to a stack through a wall or floor, the drain shall retain its full size through the wall or floor.

A sanitary drainage pipe may be connected to a pre-engineered waste water heat recovery system that incorporates piping of a lesser size than required by Sentence (1) if the drainage pipe does not convey sewage a) from a sanitary unit, or b) that contains solids.
Sentence (3) does not apply to a fixture located in a heritage building, care or detention occupancy or passenger station.

National Sentence Text:
Systems for solar heating of potable water shall be installed in conformance with
CAN/CSA-F383, “Installation of Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems.”
P/T Sentence Text: Systems for solar heating of potable water in residential occupancies shall be installed in conformance with CAN/CSA-F383, “Installation Code for Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems”.
Except as provided in Sentence (2), a system for solar heating of potable water shall be installed in accordance with good engineering practice.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.10.(1) and 9.10.9.6.(3) to (11), and Articles 3.1.9.5. and 9.10.9.7. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire stop, the requirements of fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentances 9.10.9.6.(1) and Article 9.10.16.4. of Division B of the NBC shall apply.
P/T Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings

P/T Sentence Text: The minimum diameter of drainage pipe to be used underground shall be 2".
Alteration - means a change or extension to any matter or thing or to any occupancy regulated by this Code.

Authority having jurisdiction - means the governmental body responsible for the enforcement of any part of this Code or the official or agency designated by that body to exercise such a function. Notwithstanding this definition, the Chief Inspector of Mines has the sole responsibility for administration and enforcement in respect to all buildings, structures and site services used at a mine, as defined in the Mines Act.

Field review - means a review of the work at a building site, andwhere applicable, at locations where building components are fabricated for use at the building sitethat a registered professional in his or her professional discretion considers necessary to ascertain whether the work substantially complies in all material respects with the plans and supporting documents prepared by a registered professional.

Registered professional - means person who is registered or licensed to practise as an architect under the Architects Act, ora person who is registered or licensed to practise as a professional engineer under the Engineers and Geoscientists Act.
Registered professional of record - means a registered professional retained to undertake design work and field reviews in accordance with Subsection 2.2.7. of Division C.

National Sentence Text: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3, 6 and 9 of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3, 6 and 9 of Division B of the Book I (General) of the British Columbia Building Code.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.19.(1) and 9.10.9.6.(3) to (11), and Articles 3.1.9.5. and 9.10.9.7. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.19.(1) and 9.10.9.6.(3) to (11), and Articles 3.1.9.5. and 9.10.9.7. of Division B of Book I (General) of this Code.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire stop, the requirements of fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1) and Article 9.10.16.4. of Division B of the NBC shall apply.
P/T Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire stop, the requirements of fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1) and Article 9.10.16.4. of Division B of the Book I (General) of this Code shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except in buildings of industrial occupancy as described in the NBC, or for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except in buildings of industrial occupancy as described in Book I (General) of this Code, or for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.

National Sentence Text: Where piping passes through or under a wall, it shall be installed so that the wall does not bear on the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping passes through or under a wall, it shall be installed so that the wall does not bear on the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Urinals shall not be installed adjacent to wall and floor surfaces that are pervious to water. (See Article 3.7.2.6. of Division B of the NBC.)
P/T Sentence Text: Urinals shall not be installed adjacent to wall and floor surfaces that are pervious to water. (See Article 3.7.2.6. of Division B of Book I (General) of this Code.)

National Article Title: Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.4.10.4.(2), the hydraulic load in litres from a roof or paved surface is the maximum 15 min rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3. of Division B of the NBC, multiplied by the sum of the area in square metres of the horizontal projection of the surface drained, and one-half the area in square metres of the largest adjoining vertical surface.
P/T Article Title: Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.4.10.4.(2), the hydraulic load in litres from a roof or paved surface is the maximum 15 min rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3. of Division B of Book I (General) of this Code, multiplied by the sum of the area in square metres of the horizontal projection of the surface drained, and one-half the area in square metres of the largest adjoining vertical surface.

National Sentence Text: PVC water pipe and fittings referred to in Sentences 2.2.5.6.(1), 2.2.5.6.(2) and 2.2.5.6.(3) shall not be used in a hot water system.
P/T Sentence Text: PVC water pipe and fittings referred to in Sentences 2.2.5.7.(1), 2.2.5.7.(2)and 2.2.5.7.(3) shall not be used in a hot water system.

National Article Title: CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
National Sentence Text: The design temperature and design pressure of a CPVC piping system shall conform to Table 2.2.5.7.
P/T Article Title: CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
P/T Sentence Text: The design temperature and design pressure of a CPVC piping system shall conform to Table 2.2.5.8.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.5.11.(3) and 2.2.5.11.(4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in hot water systems.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.5.12.(3)and 2.2.5.12.(4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in hot water systems.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.6.8.(2) and 2.2.6.8.(3), welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.6.8.(2)and 2.2.6.8.(3), welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.

National Sentence Text: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 2.2.6.16.
P/T Sentence Text: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 2.2.6.16.

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be protected in the absence of the pipe manufacturer’s instructions for backfill, by backfill that is (see Note A-2.3.5.1.(1)(a)) placed and compacted to a height of 300 mm over the top of the pipe, and free of stones, boulders, cinders and frozen earth or other material capable of damaging the piping, or by concrete that is at least 75 mm thick and at least 200 mm wider than the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping is installed underground, the backfill shall be carefully placed and tamped to a height of 300 mm over the top of the pipe, and free of stones, boulders, cinders and frozen earth. (See Note A-2.3.5.1.(1).)

Where vitrified clay is located less than 600 mm below a basement floor and the floor is constructed of other than 75 mm or more of concrete, the pipe shall be protected by a 75-mm layer of concrete installed above the pipe. (See Note A-2.3.5.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: No water system between the point of connection with the water service pipe or the water meter and the first branch that supplies a water heater that serves more than one fixture shall be sized less than ¾ inch.
P/T Sentence Text: Reserved

National Sentence Text: Potable water shall be used to test a potablewater system.
P/T Sentence Text: Potable water shall be used to test a potablewater system.

National Sentence Text: Non-potable water piping shall be identified by markings that are permanent, distinct and easily recognized.
P/T Sentence Text: The location of non-potable water discharge and non-potablewater piping shall be identified by markings that are permanent, distinct and easily recognized.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.7.4.1.(2), non-potable water systems shall be designed, fabricated and installed in accordance with good engineering practice, such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks, ASPE Handbooks and CSA CAN/CSA-B128.1-06 Design and Installation of Non-Potable Water Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Non-potablewater systems shall be designed, fabricated and installed in accordance with good engineering practice, such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks, ASPE Handbooks and CSA CAN/CSA-B128.1-06 Design and Installation of Non-Potable Water Systems

National Sentence Text: Non-potable water systems shall only be used to supply water closets, urinals, and directly connected underground irrigation systems that only dispense water below the surface of the ground.
P/T Sentence Text: Non-potable water piping shall not be located where food is prepared in a food-processing plant, above food-handling equipment, above a non-pressurized potable water tank, or above a cover of a pressurized potable water tank.

Notwithstanding that any provision of this Code requires certain specified materials to be used, any other material may be approved by the local authority if the material: a) is shown to be satisfactory for the purpose intended by certification from a testing laboratory that is recognized by the local authority; and b) is at least the equivalent of that required in these regulations in quality, strength, effectiveness, resistance, durability and safety.
Ancillary building means a building that depends on another building in order to function;

National Sentence Text: Drainage system means an assembly of pipes, fittings, fixtures, traps and appurtenances that is used to convey sewage, clear-water waste or storm water to a public sewer of a private sewage disposal system, but does not include subsoil drainage pipes. (See Figure A-1.4.1.2.(1)-F in Note A-1.4.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage system means an assembly of pipes, fittings, fixtures, traps and appurtenances that is used to convey sewage, clear-water waste or storm water to the property line, or to a private sewage works, but does not include a subsoil drainage pipe;

National Sentence Text: Private sewage disposal system* means a privately owned plant for the treatment and disposal of sewage (such as septic tank with an absorption field).
P/T Sentence Text: Private sewage works as defined in The Private Sewage Works Regulations;

National Sentence Text: Private water supply system means an assembly of pipes, fittings, valves, equipment and appurtenances that supplies water from a private sourced to a water distribution system.
P/T Sentence Text: Private waterworks means a privately owned works that is located on one property and is intended to be used for the supply, collection, treatment, storage and distribution of water that: a) is not a public water supply within the meaning of The Health Hazard Regulations; b) is not designated as a waterworks for the purposes of clause 2(pp) of The Environmental Management and Protection Act, 2010 and The Waterworks and Sewage Works Regulations; and c) does not include water for industrial use;

National Sentence Text: Water distribution system means an assembly of pipes, fittings, valves and appurtenances, that conveys water from the water service pipe or private water supply system to water supply outlets, fixtures, appliances and devices.
P/T Sentence Text: Water distribution system means an assembly of pipes, fittings, valves and appurtenances that convey water from the water service pipe or private waterworks to water supply outlets, fixtures, applianced and devices.

National Sentence Text: Water system means a private water supply system, or water service pipe, a water distribution system or parts thereof.
P/T Sentence Text: Water system means an assembly of pipes, fittings, control valves and appurtenances that convey water from a communal waterworks, starting at the property line or a private water supply source, to the water supply outlets or fixtures or devices.
CSA CSA B128.3-12 Performance of non-potable water reuse systems 2.7

National Sentence Text: 1) Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage disposal system.
P/T Sentence Text: 1) Every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage works.

National Sentence Text: 2) A combined building drain shall not be installed. (See Note A-2.1.2.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: 2) A combined building drain shall not be installed. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: 1 ) Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every storm drainage system shall be connected to a public storm sewer, a public combined sewer or a designated storm water disposal location.
P/T Sentence Text: 1) Every storm drainage system shall be connected to a public storm sewer, a public combined sewer or a designated storm water disposal location.

National Sentence Text: 1 ) Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every water distribution system shall be connected to a public water main or a potable private water supply system.
P/T Sentence Text: 1) Every water distribution system shall be connected to a public water system or a private waterworks.

National Sentence Text: 1 ) Piping in any building connected to the public services shall be connected separately from piping of any other building, except that an ancillary building on the same property may be served by the same service. (See Note A-2.1.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: 1) Subject to Sentences (2) to (4), piping in any building connected to a public water system, a public sanitary sewer or a public combined sewer shall be connected separately from piping of any other building.

National Sentence Text: None
P/T Sentence Text: Piping in a building may be connected to an ancillary building on the same property as the building mentioned in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: None
P/T Sentence Text: 3) Piping in a building may be connected to the piping of another building on a separate property if an easement is obtained and the local authority has approved of the proposed piping system.

National Sentence Text: None
P/T Sentence Text: 4) Plumbing systems in premises registered pursuant to The Condominium Property Act, 1993 may be extended to the property line by a single sewer pipe and a single water service pipe.

National Sentence Text: 1) Where a fixture or equipment discharges sewage or waste that may damage or impair the sanitary drainage system or the functioning of a public or private sewage disposal system, provision shall be made for treatment of the sewage or waste before it is discharged to the sanitary drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: 1) Where a fixture or equipment discharges sewage or waste that may damage or impair the sanitary drainage system or the functioning of a communal or private sewage disposal system, provision shall be made for treatment of the sewage or waste before it is discharged to the sanitary drainage system.

National Article Title: Size of Building Drain and Building Sewer
National Sentence Text: 1) Building drains and building sewers connected to the public sewer system downstream of the main cleanout (see Sentence 2.4.7.1.(6)) shall be not less than 4 inches in size.
P/T Article Title: Size of Building Drain and Building Sewer
P/T Sentence Text: Building drains and building sewers connected to the public sewer system (see Sentence 2.4.7.1.(6)) shall not be less than 4 inches in size.

National Sentence Text: None
P/T Sentence Text: Island venting is permitted.

National Sentence Text: 1) A backflow preventer shall not be required in residential full flow-through fire sprinkler/standpipe systems in which the pipes and fittings are constructed of potable water system materials.
P/T Sentence Text: A backflow preventer shall not be required in residential full flow-through fire sprinkler/standpipe systems in which the pipes and fittings are constructed of potable water system materials.

National Sentence Text: 2) Except as required by Sentence (4), potable water system connections to fire sprinkler and standpipe systems shall be protected against backflow caused by back-siphonage or back pressure in conformance with Clauses (a) to (f): a) residential partial flow-through fire sprinkler/standpipe systems in which the pipes and fittings are constructed of potable water system materials shall be protected by a dual check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.6.l, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (Du CF), b) Class 1 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems shall be protected by a single check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.9, "Single Check Valve Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (SCVAF)," provided that the systems do not use antifreeze or other additives of any kind and that all pipes and fittings are constructed of potable water system materials, c) Class lfire sprinkler/standpipe systems not covered by Clause (b) as well as Class 2 and Class 3 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems shall be protected by a double check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.5.l, "Double Check Valve Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (DCVAF)," provided that the systems do not use antifreeze or other additives of any kind, d) Class 1, Class 2 and Class 3 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems in which antifreeze or other additives are used shall be protected by a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.l, "Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (RPF)," installed on the portion of the system that uses the additives and the balance of the system shall be protected as required by Clauses (b) or (c), e) Class 4 and Class 5 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems shall be protected by a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.l, "Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (RPF)," or f) Class 6 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems shall be protected i) by a double check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.5.l, "Double Check Valve Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (DCVAF)," or ii) where a otentially severe health hazard may be caused by backflow, by a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.l, "Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (RPF). (See Note A-2.6.2.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Backflow caused by back-siphonage or back pressure from fire sprinkler systems where water treatment is not added shall be prevented by the installation of not less than an Approved Double Check Valve Assembly, and such a device shall not adversely affect the designed performance of the system.

National Sentence Text: 3) Backflow preventers required by Sentence (2) shall be installed upstream of the fire department pumper connection. (See Note A-2.6.2.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Backflow caused by back-siphonage or back pressure from standpipe systems if water treatment is not added shall be prevented by the installation of not less than an Approved Double Check Valve Assembly, and such a device shall not adversely affect the designed performance of the system.

National Sentence Text: 4) Where a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer is required on a water service pipe at a fire service connection located on the same premises as the fire service pipe in Class 3, 4, 5 and 6 fire sprinkler/standpipe systems, a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.4.l, "Reduced Pressure Principle Backflow Preventers for Fire Protection Systems (RPF)," shall also be required on the fire service connection.
P/T Sentence Text: Repealed

National Sentence Text: 1) No private water supply system shall be interconnected with a public water supply system.
P/T Sentence Text: 1 )Subject to Sentence (2), no water system that includes a connection to a private water source shall be interconnected with a communal waterworks.

National Sentence Text: None
P/T Sentence Text:
2) A water system that includes a connection to a private water source may be interconnected with a communal waterworks if:
(a) the owner of the communal waterworks provides written approval to the local authority; and
(b) the water system and the connection to the communal waterworks is not located in a city, town, village or resort village or subdivision consisting of 3 or more lots.

National Sentence Text: 1) A non-potable water system shall not be connected to a potable water system.
P/T Sentence Text: 1) Subject to Sentence (2), a non-potable water system shall not be connected to a potable water system.

National Sentence Text: None
P/T Sentence Text: 2) Unless otherwise approved by the local authority, a non-potable water system shall not be connected to a private waterworks unless the non-potable water passes through functioning equipment capable of rendering the water potable and that equipment is located so that all water entering the system passes through the equipment

National Sentence Text: 1 ) An outlet from a non-potable water system shall not be located where it can discharge into a) a sink or lavatory, b) a fixture into which an outlet from a potable water system is discharged, or c) a fixture that is used for the preparation, handling or dispensing of food, drink or products that are intended for human consumption. (See Note A-2.7.3.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: 1) Unless approved by the local authority, an outlet from a non-potable water supply shall not be located where it can discharge into: (a) a sink or lavatory, (b) a fixture into which an outlet from a potable water system is discharged, or (c) a fixture that is used for the preparation, handling or dispensing of food, drink or products that are intended for human consumption.

National Sentence Text: None
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence (1) does not apply to waterworks authorized to supply water for hygienic use within the meaning of sections 22 or 23 of The Water Regulations, 2002 .

National Sentence Text: None
P/T Sentence Text: 3) Where a non-potable water system that utilizes sewage is installed, it shall conform to CSA B128.3-12, ‘Performance of non-potable water reuse systems’ and produce an effluent with a water quality suitable for the use to which it is put.

National Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall conform to CSA A257.1-14 Non-Reinforced Circular Concrete Culvert, Storm Drain, Sewer Pipe, and Fittings or CSA A257.2-14 Reinforced Circular Concrete Culvert, Storm Drain, Sewer Pipe, and Fittings
Joints with internal elastomeric gaskets shall conform to CSA A257.3-14 Joints for Circular Concrete Sewer and Culvert Pipe, Manhole Sections, and Fittings Using Rubber Gaskets
Concrete fittings fabricated on the site from lengths of pipe shall not be used. (See Note A-2.2.5.1.(3).)
Concrete pipe shall not be used above ground inside a building.
Precast reinforced circular concrete manhole sections, catch basins and fittings shall conform to CSA A257.4-14 Precast Reinforced Circular Concrete Manhole Sections, Catch Basins, and Fittings
Threaded cast-iron drainage fittings shall conform to ASME B16.12-2009 Cast Iron Threaded Drainage Fittings
Threaded cast-iron drainage fittings shall not be used in a water system.
Where piping passes through or under a wall, it shall be installed so that the wall does not bear on the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where vitrified clay drainage pipe is located less than 600 mm below a basement floor and the floor is constructed of other than 75 mm or more of concrete, the pipe shall be protected by a 75-mm layer of concrete installed above the pipe. (See Note A-2.3.5.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: This Part applies to all plumbing systems covered in this Code. (See Article 1.1.1.1..)
P/T Sentence Text: The scope of this Part shall be as described in Subsection 1.1.2. of Division A.
Where gravity drainage to a sanitary drainage system is possible, a floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.

Where gravity drainage to a sanitary drainage system is not possible, the floor drain required by Sentence (1) may be connected to a storm drainage system, dry well or drainage ditch provided it is located where it can receive only clear water waste or storm sewage.
A floor drain shall be provided in a public laundry room, garbage room, incinerator room, boiler or heating room that is not located within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage disposal system.
P/T Sentence Text: Every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage disposal system.

National Sentence Text: A combined building drain shall not be installed. (See Note A-2.1.2.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A combined building drain or a combined building sewer shall not be installed.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every storm drainage system shall be connected to a public storm sewer, a public combined sewer or a designated storm water disposal location.
P/T Sentence Text: Every storm drainage system shall be connected to a public storm sewage works, a public combined sewage works or a designated storm water disposal location but shall not be connected to a sanitary sewage works.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every water distribution system shall be connected to a public water main or a potable private water supply system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), every water distribution system shall be connected,(a) to a watermain that is part of a municipal drinking water system, or (b) to a drinking water system, if a watermain described in Clause (a) is not available.

Storm sewage or greywater that is free of solids and treated to conform to Article 7.7.4.1. is permitted to be used as a water supply for,(a) water closets, (b) urinals, (c) sub-surface irrigation, or (d) the priming of traps.

Rainwater that is free of solids and treated to conform to Article 7.7.4.1. is permitted to be used as a water supply for,(a) clothes washers, (b) laundry trays, (c) mop sinks, (d) bedpan washers, (e) water closets, (f) urinals, (g) hose bibbs, (h) sub-surface irrigation, or (i) the priming of traps.
Piping conveying the non-potable water described in Sentence (2) shall be installed in conformance with Section 7.7.

National Sentence Text: Piping in any building connected to the public services shall be connected separately from piping of any other building, except that an ancillary building on the same property may be served by the same service. (See Note A-2.1.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), piping in any building shall be connected to the public services separately from piping of any other building. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Piping in any building connected to the public services shall be connected separately from piping of any other building, except that an ancillary building on the same property may be served by the same service. (See Note A-2.1.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: An ancillary building on the same property as the main building may be served by the same service.

No plumbing serving a dwelling unit shall be installed in or under another unit of the building unless the piping is located in a tunnel, pipe corridor, common basement or parking garage, so that the piping is accessible for servicing and maintenance throughout its length without encroachment on any private living space, but this Sentence does not prevent plumbing serving a unit located above another unit from being installed in or under the lower unit.

P/T Article Title: 7.1.5.5. Private Sewers and Private Water Supply
P/T Sentence Text: Private water supply pipes shall be designed and installed according to MOE PIBS 6881e, "Design Guidelines for Drinking-Water Systems".

P/T Article Title: 7.1.5.5. Private Sewers and Private Water Supply
P/T Sentence Text: Private sewers shall be designed and installed according to MOE PIBS 6879, "Design Guidelines for Sewage Works".

National Sentence Text: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3, 6 and 9 of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3 and 9.

National Sentence Text: Every fixture, appliance, interceptor, cleanout, valve, device or piece of equipment shall be located so that it is readily accessible for use, cleaning and maintenance.
P/T Sentence Text: Every fixture, plumbing appliance, interceptor, cleanout, valve, device or piece of equipment shall be so located that it is readily accessible for use, cleaning and maintenance.
Plumbing shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum relative structural movement provided for in the construction of the building.

National Sentence Text: Where unusual conditions exist, such as excessively corrosive soil or water, only materials suited for use in such locations shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where unusual conditions exist such as excessively corrosive soil or water, only materials suited for use in such locations shall be used.

Used materials and equipment, including fixtures, shall not be reused unless they meet the requirements of this Part for new materials and equipment and are otherwise satisfactory for their intended use.

National Sentence Text:
(1) Every length of pipe and every fitting shall have cast, stamped or indelibly marked on it the maker's name or mark and the weight or class or quality of the product, or be marked in accordance with the relevant standard.
(2) Markings required in Sentence 2.2.1.3.(1) shall be visible after installation.
P/T Sentence Text: Every length of pipe and every fitting shall have cast, stamped or indelibly marked on it the maker’s name or mark and the weight or class or quality of the product, or it shall be marked in accordance with the relevant standard, and such markings shall be visible after installation.

Where a component of a plumbing system is required by this Code to comply with a standard and the compliance is not certified by a testing agency accredited by the Standards Council of Canada for the testing of the component in question and, when an inspector requests proof of the compliance, proof of compliance shall be produced by the person proposing to install or have installed the component, and without such proof the component shall not be installed as a permanent part of any plumbing system.
The lack of certification markings on a product or plumbing component shall be regarded as proof, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, that no certification exists.
If a component of a plumbing system is required to be certified to a standard, the certification shall be made by a testing agency accredited for that purpose by the Standards Council of Canada.

National Sentence Text: Where the term pipe or piping is used, it shall also apply to tube or tubing unless otherwise stated.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the term pipe or piping and fittings is used, it shall also apply to tube or tubing and fittings unless otherwise stated.
Piping, fittings and joints used in pressure sewer, forcemain or sump pump discharge applications shall be capable of withstanding at least one and one-half times the maximum potential pressure.

National Article Title: Working Pressure of a Water Service Pipe
National Sentence Text: The working pressure rating of a water service pipe shall not be less than the maximum water main pressure at their point of connection as established by the water supply authority.
Every fixture shall have a smooth, hard, corrosion-resistant surface free of flaws and blemishes that may interfere with cleaning.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the area designed to be slip proof in such fixtures, every exposed area of a fixture shall have a smooth, hard corrosion-resistant surface that is free from flaws and blemishes that may interfere with cleaning.
Water closets and urinals shall conform to the requirements in Article 7.6.4.2.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.2 / CSA B45.1, "Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Enamelled cast iron fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.1 / CSA B45.2, "Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Porcelain enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.1 / CSA B45.2, "Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.3 / CSA B45.4, "Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5 / IAPMO Z124, "Plastic Plumbing Fixtures".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME A112.19.7 / CSA B45.10, "Hydromassage Bathtub Systems".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME A112.3.4 / CSA B45.9, "Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems".

National Sentence Text: Shower receptors shall be constructed and arranged so that water cannot leak through the walls or floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Shower receptors shall be constructed and arranged so that water cannot leak through the walls or floor.

National Sentence Text: Not more than 6 shower heads shall be served by a single shower drain.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than six shower heads shall be served by a single shower drain.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more shower heads are served by a shower drain, the floor shall be sloped and the drain located so that water from one head cannot flow over the area that serves another head. (See Note A-2.2.2.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where two or more shower heads are served by a shower drain, the floor shall be sloped and the drain located so that water from one head cannot flow over the area that serves another head.

National Sentence Text: Except for column showers, when a battery of shower heads is installed, the horizontal distance between 2 adjacent shower heads shall be not less than 750 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for column showers, when a battery of shower heads is installed, the horizontal distance between two adjacent shower heads shall be at least 750 mm.

National Sentence Text: A dishwashing sink and a food preparation sink shall not have concealed overflows. (See Note A-2.2.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A dishwashing sink and a food preparation sink shall not have concealed overflows.

National Sentence Text: When a water closet is installed in a washroom for public use, it shall be of the elongated type and provided with a seat of the open front type.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for Eastern-Style toilets, where a water closet is installed in a washroom for public use it shall be of the elongated type and provided with a seat of the open front type.
A lavatory that does not have an overflow shall be equipped with a centre outlet waste fitting.
No trough urinal shall be used as part of a plumbing system.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided for in Sentence 2.2.3.1.(2), traps shall have a trap seal depth of not less than 38 mm, be so designed that failure of the seal walls will cause exterior leakage, and have a water seal that does not depend on the action of moving parts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided for in Sentence (2), every trap shall,(a) have a trap seal depth of at least 38 mm, (b) be so designed that failure of the seal walls will cause exterior leakage, and (c) have a water seal that does not depend on the action of moving parts.
The trap seal depth on fixtures draining to an acid waste system shall be a minimum of 50 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except for a floor-mounted service sink, every trap that serves a lavatory, a sink or a laundry tray shall be provided with a cleanout plug located at the lowest point of the trap and of the same material as the trap, except that a cast-iron trap shall be provided with a brass cleanout plug, or be designed so that part of the trap can be removed for cleaning purposes.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a floor-mounted service sink, every trap that serves a lavatory, a sink or a laundry tray shall, (a) be provided with a cleanout plug of a minimum ¾ in. size located at the lowest point of the trap and of the same material as the trap, except that a cast iron trap shall be provided with a brass cleanout plug, (b) be designed so that the trap dip can be completely removed for cleaning purposes, or (c) be provided with a cleanout installed above the floor as close as practical downstream of the trap when the trap is, (i) installed below the floor, and (ii) not readily accessible for cleaning as required by Clause (a).

National Sentence Text: A bell trap shall not be installed in a drainage system. (See Note A-2.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: A bell trap or an S-trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: A drum trap shall not be used as a fixture trap unless required to serve as an interceptor and access for servicing is provided.
P/T Sentence Text: A drum trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.
Except as permitted in Sentence (7), no bottle trap shall be used in a plumbing system.
A bottle trap may be used on a laboratory sink or other fixture equipped with corrosion resistant fittings.

No running trap shall be installed in a plumbing system unless an accessible handhole is provided for cleaning of the trap, and where the trap is too small to accommodate a handhole, a cleanout shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Interceptors shall be designed so that they can be readily cleaned.
P/T Sentence Text: Every interceptor shall be designed so that it can be readily cleaned.

National Sentence Text: Grease interceptors shall be designed so that they do not become air bound, and not have a water jacket.
P/T Sentence Text: Every grease interceptor shall be designed so that it does not become air bound.

Where a grease interceptor is required by Sentence 7.4.4.3.(1), the interceptor shall conform to, (a) CSA B481.1, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Lard", or (b) CSA B481.2, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Oil".

National Sentence Text: Grease interceptors shall be selected and installed in conformance with CSA B481.0 Material, Design, and Construction Requirements for Grease Interceptors and CSA B481.3 Sizing, Selection, Location, and Installation of Grease Interceptors
P/T Sentence Text: Grease interceptors shall be selected and installed in conformance with,(a) CSA B481.0, "Material, Design, and Construction Requirements for Grease Interceptors", and (b) CSA B481.3, "Sizing, Selection, Location, and Installation of Grease Interceptors".

National Sentence Text: Tubular metal or plastic traps conforming to ASME/CSA ASME A112.18.2/CSA B125.2 Plumbing Waste Fittings shall be used only in accessible locations.
P/T Sentence Text: Tubular metal or plastic traps that conform to ASME A112.18.2 / CSA B125.2, "Plumbing Waste Fittings" shall be used in accessible locations.

National Sentence Text: A T fitting shall not be used in a drainage system, except to connect a vent pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: A T fitting shall not be used in a drainage system except to connect a vent pipe.

National Sentence Text: A single or double sanitary T fitting shall not be used in a nominally horizontal soil-or-waste pipe, except that a single sanitary T fitting may be used to connect a vent pipe.
A double sanitary T fitting shall not be used to connect the trap arms of back outlet water closets installed back-to-back, or 2 urinals where no cleanout fitting is provided above the connection.
P/T Sentence Text: A double sanitary T fitting shall not be used to connect the fixture drains of two urinals where no cleanout fitting is provided above the connection.
No pipe fitting, joint or connection that would tend to intercept solids or reduce the flow through a pipe by more than 10 percent shall be used in a plumbing system.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 2.2.4.3.(2), 90° elbows of 4 inch size or less whose centre-line radius is less than the size of the pipe shall not be used to join 2 soil-or-waste pipes.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), 90° elbows of 4 in. size or less that have a centre-line radius that is less than the size of the pipe shall not be used to join two soil or waste pipes.

National Sentence Text: For sanitary drainage systems of 4 inch size or less, 90° elbows described in Sentence 2.2.4.3.(1) shall only be permitted to change the direction of piping from horizontal to vertical, in the direction of flow, where a trap arm enters a wall, or to connect trap arms as permitted by Sentence 2.5.6.3.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: 90° elbows of 4 in. size or less in sanitary drainage systems may be used,(a) to change the direction of piping from horizontal to vertical, in the direction of flow, (b) where a trap arm enters a wall, or (c) to connect trap arms as permitted by Sentence 7.5.6.3.(2).
A 90° elbow that is part of the pre-engineered wastewater heat recovery system is permitted to have a centre-line radius that is less than the size of the pipe.
No double Y, double TY, double T or double waste fitting shall be installed in a nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe.
Pipe or tubing assembled to comprise a standard drain waste and venting system shall be connected with drain, waste and vent fittings in conformance with Table 7.2.4.5.

National Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall conform to CSA A257.1 Non-Reinforced Circular Concrete Culvert, Storm Drain, Sewer Pipe, and Fittings or CSA A257.2 Reinforced Circular Concrete Culvert, Storm Drain, Sewer Pipe, and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall conform to CSA A257 Series, "Standards for Concrete Pipe and Manhole Sections".

Joints with external elastomeric gaskets shall be made with corrosion resistant external band type flexible mechanical couplings that conform to CSA B602, "Mechanical Couplings for Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Sewer Pipe".

National Sentence Text: Joints with internal elastomeric gaskets shall conform to CSA A257.3-14 Joints for Circular Concrete Sewer and Culvert Pipe, Manhole Sections, and Fittings Using Rubber Gaskets
Concrete fittings fabricated on the site from lengths of pipe shall not be used. (See Note A-2.2.5.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete fittings field fabricated from lengths of pipe shall not be used. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall not be used above ground inside a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall not be used above ground inside a building.

National Sentence Text: Precast reinforced circular concrete manhole sections, catch basins and fittings shall conform to CSA A257.4, Precast Reinforced Circular Concrete Manhole Sections, Catch Basins, and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Precast reinforced circular concrete manhole sections, catch basins and fittings shall conform to CSA A257.4, "Precast Reinforced Circular Concrete Manhole Sections, Catch Basins, and Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall conform to CSA A60.1-M Vitrified Clay Pipe
P/T Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall be certified to CSA A60.1-M, "Vitrified Clay Pipe".

National Sentence Text: Couplings and joints for vitrified clay pipe shall conform to CSA A60.3-M Vitrified Clay Pipe Joints
P/T Sentence Text: Couplings and joints for vitrified clay pipe shall be certified to CSA A60.3-M, "Vitrified Clay Pipe Joints".

National Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall not be used except for an underground part of a drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall not be used except for an underground part of a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Polyethylene water pipe, tubing and fittings shall conform to Series 160 of CSA B137.1 Polyethylene (PE) Pipe, Tubing, and Fittings for Cold-Water Pressure Services
P/T Sentence Text: Polyethylene water pipe, tubing and fittings shall be certified to, and have a pressure rating meeting the requirements of, Series 160 or a higher series of CSA B137.1, "Polyethylene (PE) Pipe, Tubing and Fittings for Cold Water Pressure Services".

National Sentence Text: Polyethylene water pipe shall not be used except for a water service pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 7.2.5.7.(1), polyethylene water pipe shall not be used except for a water service pipe.

National Sentence Text: Butt fusion fittings for polyethylene pipe shall conform to ASTM D 3261  Butt Heat Fusion Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Fittings for Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Pipe and Tubing
P/T Sentence Text: Butt fusion fittings for polyethylene pipe shall conform to ASTM D3261, "Butt Heat Fusion Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Fittings for Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Pipe and Tubing".

National Sentence Text: Polyethylene pipe used underground outside a building for the rehabilitation of existing drainage systems using trenchless technology shall conform to ASTM F 714, Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Pipe (DR-PR) Based on Outside Diameter and shall be HDPE 3408 and SDR 11 or heavier. (See Note A-2.2.5.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Polyethylene pipe used underground in a drainage system for rehabilitation of existing systems using trenchless technology shall conform to ASTM F714, "Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Pipe (DR-PR) Based on Outside Diameter" and shall be HDPE 3408, SDR 17 or heavier. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Crosslinked polyethylene pipe and its associated fittings used in hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.5, Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX) Tubing Systems for Pressure Applications (See Note A-2.2.5.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Crosslinked polyethylene pipe and its associated fittings used in hot and cold potable water systems shall be certified to CSA B137.5, "Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX) Tubing Systems for Pressure Applications"..

National Sentence Text: PVC water pipe, fittings and solvent cement shall conform to CSA B137.3 Rigid Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications and have a pressure rating of not less than 1 100 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: PVC water pipe, fittings and solvent cement shall be certified to CSA B137.3, "Rigid Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications" or CSA B137.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Injection-Moulded Gasketed Fittings for Pressure Applications", and have a minimum pressure rating of 1 100 kPa.

National Sentence Text: PVC water pipe and fittings referred to in Sentences 2.2.5.6.(1), 2.2.5.6.(2) and 2.2.5.6.(3) shall not be used in a hot water system.
P/T Sentence Text: PVC water pipe and fittings in Sentence (1) shall not be used in a hot water system.

National Article Title: CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
National Sentence Text: CPVC hot and cold water pipe, fittings and solvent cements shall conform to CSA B137.6 Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Pipe, Tubing, and Fittings for Hot- and Cold-Water Distribution Systems
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.9. CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
P/T Sentence Text: CPVC hot and cold water pipe, fittings and solvent cements shall be certified to CSA B137.6, "Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Pipe, Tubing and Fittings for Hot and Cold Water Distribution Systems".

National Article Title: CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
National Sentence Text: The design temperature and design pressure of a CPVC piping system shall conform to Table 2.2.5.7.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.9. CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
P/T Sentence Text: The design temperature and design pressure of a CPVC piping system shall conform to Table 7.2.5.9.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used Underground
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.10. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used Underground
P/T Sentence Text: Plastic pipe, fittings and solvent cement used underground outside a building or under a building in a drainage system shall be certified to,(a) ASTM F628, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Schedule 40 Plastic Drain, Waste and Vent Pipe With a Cellular Core", (b) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", (c) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", (d) CAN/CSA-B182.1, "Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings", (e) CAN/CSA-B182.2, "PSM Type Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Sewer Pipe and Fittings", (f) CAN/CSA-B182.4, "Profile Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Sewer Pipe and Fittings", (g) CAN/CSA-B182.6, "Profile Polyethylene (PE) Sewer Pipe and Fittings for Leak-Proof Sewer Applications", (g.1) CAN/CSA-B182.8, "Profile Polyethylene (PE) Storm Sewer and Drainage Pipe and Fittings", for Type 1 joints and non-perforated pipes, (h) CSA B137.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Injection-Moulded Gasketed Fittings for Pressure Applications", or (i) CSA B137.3, "Rigid Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications".

P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.10. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used Underground
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Clauses (h) and (i), plastic pipe used as described in Sentence (1) shall have a stiffness equal or greater than 320 kPa.

National Sentence Text: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2 Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to,(a) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (b) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Transition solvent cement shall only be used for joining an ABS drainage system to a PVC drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Transition solvent cement shall only be used for joining an ABS plumbing system to a PVC plumbing system.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Plastic pipe, fittings and solvent cement used inside or under a building in a drainage or venting system shall conform to ASTM F 628 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Schedule 40 Plastic Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe With a Cellular Core CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2 Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Plastic pipe, fittings and solvent cement used inside or under a building in a sanitary drainage system or venting system shall be certified to,(a) ASTM F628, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Schedule 40 Plastic Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe With a Cellular Core", (b) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (c) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".

P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Plastic pipe, fittings and solvent cement used inside a building in a storm drainage system shall be certified to,(a) ASTM F628, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Schedule 40 Plastic Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe With a Cellular Core", (b) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", (c) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", (d) CAN/CSA-B182.1, "Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (e) CAN/CSA-B182.2, "PSM Type Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Sewer Pipe and Fittings".

P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings )
P/T Sentence Text: Plastic pipe used as described in Sentence (2) shall have a pipe stiffness equal or greater than 320 kPa.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.19.(1) and 9.10.9.6.(3) to (11), and Articles 3.1.9.5. and 9.10.9.7. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.16.(1) and 9.10.9.6.(2) to (8) and Articles 3.1.9.4. and 9.10.9.7.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire stop, the requirements of fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1) and Article 9.10.16.4. of Division B of the NBC shall apply.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire block, the requirements for fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1) and Article 9.10.16.4. shall apply.

National Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE composite pipe and fittings shall conform to CSA B137.9 Polyethylene/Aluminum/Polyethylene (PE-AL-PE) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems (See Note A-2.2.5.11.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE composite pipe and fittings used for potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.9, "Polyethylene/Aluminum/Polyethylene (PE-AL-PE) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.5.11.(3) and 2.2.5.11.(4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in hot water systems.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in a hot water system.

National Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82°C shall be permitted for hot water systems.
P/T Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82ºC shall be permitted in a hot water system.

National Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82°C shall be used with fittings that conform to CSA B137.10 Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX-AL-PEX) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems in hot water systems.
P/T Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82ºC shall be used with fittings that conform to CSA B137.10, "Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX-AL-PEX) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems", in a hot water system.

National Sentence Text: PEX/AL/PEX composite pipe and fittings used in hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.10, Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX-AL-PEX) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems (See Note A-2.2.5.12.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.14. Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Polyethylene Composite Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: PEX/AL/PEX composite pipe and fittings used for potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.10, "Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX-AL-PEX) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems".

National Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipe and fittings used for hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.11,  Polypropylene (PP-R) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications (See Note A-2.2.5.13.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipe and fittings used for hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.11, "Polypropylene (PP-R) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications".

National Article Title: Cast-Iron Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
National Sentence Text: Drainage piping, vent piping and fittings made of cast iron shall conform to CSA B70, Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.1. Cast Iron Frames, Covers, Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage piping, vent piping and fittings made of cast iron shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B70, "Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings and Means of Joining".

National Article Title: Cast-Iron Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
National Sentence Text: Cast-iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.1. Cast Iron Frames, Covers, Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system.

National Sentence Text: Cast-iron frames and covers for maintenance holes and catch basins shall conform to CSA B70.1, Frames and Covers for Maintenance Holes and Catchbasins
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.1. Cast Iron Frames, Covers, Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron frames and covers for maintenance holes and catch basins shall conform to CAN/CSA-B70.1, "Frames and Covers for Maintenance Holes and Catchbasins".

National Sentence Text: Threaded cast-iron drainage fittings shall conform to ASME B16.12, Cast Iron Threaded Drainage Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Threaded cast iron drainage fittings shall conform to ASME B16.12, "Cast Iron Threaded Drainage Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Threaded cast-iron drainage fittings shall not be used in a water system.
P/T Sentence Text: Threaded cast iron drainage fittings shall not be used in a water system.

National Sentence Text: Cast-iron water pipes shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C151/A21.51, Ductile-Iron Pipe, Centrifugally Cast
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C151/A21.51, "Ductile-Iron Pipe, Centrifugally Cast".

National Sentence Text: Cement mortar lining for cast-iron water pipes shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C104/A21.4, Cement-Mortar Lining for Ductile-Iron Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Cement-mortar lining for cast iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C104 / A21.4, "Cement-Mortar Lining for Ductile-Iron Pipe and Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Cast-iron fittings for cast-iron or ductile-iron water pipes shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C110/A21.10, Ductile-Iron and Gray-Iron Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron fittings for cast iron or ductile-iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C110 / A21.10, "Ductile-Iron and Gray-Iron Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Rubber gasket joints for cast-iron and ductile-iron pressure pipe for water shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C111/A21.11, Rubber-Gasket Joints for Ductile-Iron Pressure Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Rubber gasket joints for cast iron and ductile-iron pressure pipe for water piping shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C111 / A21.11, "Rubber-Gasket Joints for Ductile-Iron Pressure Pipe and Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Screwed cast-iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.4, Gray Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed cast iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.4, "Gray Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250".

National Sentence Text: Screwed cast-iron water fittings used in a water system shall be cement-mortar lined or galvanized.
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed cast iron water fittings used in a water system shall be cement-mortar lined or galvanized.

National Sentence Text: Screwed cast-iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed cast iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.3, Malleable Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 150 and 300
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.3, "Malleable Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 150 and 300".

National Sentence Text: Screwed cmalleable iron water fittings used in a water system shall be cement-mortar lined or galvanized.
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed cmalleable iron water fittings used in a water system shall be cement-mortar lined or galvanized.

National Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.6.7.(2) and 2.2.6.7.(3), welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe is permitted to be used in a drainage system or a venting system above ground inside a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe may be used in a drainage system or a venting system above ground inside a building.

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except in buildings of industrial occupancy as described in the NBC, or for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except, (a) in buildings of industrial occupancy, or (b) for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall conform to ASTM A 53/A 53M, Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and Seamless
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall conform to ASTM A53 / A53M, "Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot Dipped, Zinc-Coated Welded and Seamless".
Where galvanized steel pipe is used in a drainage system, it shall be used with drainage fittings.
All steel pipe of 4 in. size and smaller shall be schedule 40 or heavier and fittings of less than 2 in. size shall be galvanized screw fittings.

National Sentence Text: Corrugated steel pipe and couplings shall conform to CSA G401 Corrugated Steel Pipe Products
P/T Sentence Text: Corrugated steel pipe and couplings shall be certified to CAN/CSA-G401, "Corrugated Steel Pipe Products".

National Sentence Text: Corrugated steel pipe shall only be used underground outside a building in a storm drainage system
P/T Sentence Text: Corrugated steel pipe shall only be used underground outside a building in a storm drainage system

National Sentence Text: Couplings for corrugated steel pipe shall be constructed so that when installed they shall maintain the pipe alignment, resist the separation of adjoining lengths of pipe, prevent root penetration, and prevent the infiltration of surrounding material.
P/T Sentence Text: Couplings for corrugated steel pipe shall be constructed so that when installed they shall, (a) maintain the pipe alignment, (b) resist the separation of adjoining lengths of pipe, (c) prevent root penetration, and (d) prevent the infiltration of surrounding material.

National Sentence Text: A sheet metal leader shall not be used except above ground outside a building.
P/T Sentence Text: A sheet metal leader shall not be used except above ground outside a building.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe shall conform to ASME B36.19M-2004 Stainless Steel Pipe and ASTM A 312/A 312M, Seamless, Welded, and Heavily Cold Worked Stainless Steel Pipes
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe shall conform to,(a) ASME B36.19M, "Stainless Steel Pipe", and (b) ASTM A312 / A312M, "Seamless, Welded, and Heavily Cold Worked Stainless Steel Pipes".

National Sentence Text: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel pipe shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel pipe shall be used.

National Article Title: Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
National Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall conform to ASME B16.9, Factory Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings and ASTM A 403/A 403M-16 Wrought Austenitic Stainless Steel Piping Fittings
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.11. Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.9, "Factory-Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings", and (b) ASTM A403 / A403M, "Wrought Austenitic Stainless Steel Piping Fittings".

National Article Title: Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
National Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.11. Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall conform to ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard and ASTM A 182/A 182M, Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service or AWWA ANSI/AWWA C228, Stainless-Steel Pipe Flanges for Water Service – Sizes 2 in. through 72 in. (50 mm through 1,800 mm)
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall,(a) conform to ASME B16.5, "Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard", and (b) conform to ASTM A182 / A182M, "Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service", or AWWA C228, "Stainless-Steel Pipe Flanges For Water Service – Sizes 2 in. through 72 in. (50 mm through 1 800 mm)".

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be schedule 40s or greater conforming to ASTM A 182/A 182M-16a Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service or ASTM A 351/A 351M-16 Castings, Austenitic, for Pressure-Containing Parts
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be Schedule 40 or greater and shall conform to,(a) ASTM A182 / A182M, "Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service", or (b) ASTM A351 / A351M, "Castings, Austenitic, for Pressure-Containing Parts".

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel tube shall conform to ASME B16.9-2012 Factory Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings and ASTM A 269, Seamless and Welded Austenitic Stainless Steel Tubing for General Service
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel tube shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.9, "Factory-Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings", and (b) ASTM A269, "Seamless and Welded Austenitic Stainless Steel Tubing for General Service".

National Sentence Text: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel tube shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel tubes shall be used.

National Sentence Text: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 2.2.6.15.
P/T Sentence Text: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 7.2.6.15.

National Sentence Text: Copper pipe shall conform to ASTM B 42, Seamless Copper Pipe, Standard Sizes
P/T Sentence Text: Copper pipe shall conform to ASTM B42, "Seamless Copper Pipe, Standard Sizes".

National Sentence Text: Brass pipe shall conform to ASTM B 43, Seamless Red Brass Pipe, Standard Sizes
P/T Sentence Text: Brass pipe shall conform to ASTM B43, "Seamless Red Brass Pipe, Standard Sizes".

National Article Title: Brass or Bronze Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings
National Sentence Text: Brass or bronze pipe flanges and flanged fittings shall conform to ASME B16.24, Cast Copper Alloy Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: Classes 150, 300, 600, 900, 1500, and 2500
P/T Article Title: 7.2.7.2. Brass or Bronze Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Brass or bronze pipe flanges and flanged fittings shall conform to ASME B16.24, "Cast Copper Alloy Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: Classes 150, 300, 600, 900, 1500 and 2500".

National Article Title: Brass or Bronze Threaded Water Fittings
National Sentence Text: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.15, Cast Copper Alloy Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250
P/T Article Title: 7.2.7.3. Brass or Bronze Threaded Water Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.15, "Cast Copper Alloy Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250".

National Article Title: Brass or Bronze Threaded Water Fittings
National Sentence Text: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.7.3. Brass or Bronze Threaded Water Fittings
